author: Special Correspondent
text:
They died in fire accident while working on Nasra tunnel in J&K two months ago

The authorities have completed DNA testing of all nine labourers who were charred to death beyond recognition on January 1 while working on the Nasra tunnel, and brought an end to more than two-month-long agony of the families.

“We have matched the DNA samples of relatives with the victims and identified all nine persons who died in the accident,” said Banihal District Magistrate Bashir Ahmad Dar.

Ten persons, mainly labourers, were charred to death on January 1 in Ramban’s Chanderkote area. They were working on the Nasra tunnel on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway and were engaged by a private company.

The remains of the bodies, burnt beyond recognition, were placed in caskets and buried in Ramban for identification.

“Once we received the forensic report, the bodies were exhumed and handed over to legal heirs,” said Mr. Dar.

While three victims hailed from Punjab and Himachal Pradesh, six were locals, from the Chenab Valley region.

Out of 10, only one victim could be identified in January as Rakesh Kumar, a resident of Himachal Pradesh.
title: 9 workers killed in J&K tunnel fire identified
